# pickerView(_:titleForRow:forComponent:)

**Instance Method**

Called by the picker view when it needs the title to use for a given row in a given component.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor optional func pickerView(_ pickerView: UIPickerView, titleForRow row: Int, forComponent component: Int) -> String?
```

## Parameters

- **pickerView**: An object representing the picker view requesting the data.
- **row**: A zero-indexed number identifying a row of `component`. Rows are numbered top-to-bottom.
- **component**: A zero-indexed number identifying a component of `pickerView`. Components are numbered left-to-right.

## Return Value

The string to use as the title of the indicated component row.

## Discussion

If you implement both this method and the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPickerViewDelegate/pickerView(_:attributedTitleForRow:forComponent:)] method, the picker view prefers the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPickerViewDelegate/pickerView(_:attributedTitleForRow:forComponent:)] method. However, if that method returns `nil`, the picker view falls back to using the string returned by this method.

## Setting the content of component rows

- **pickerView(_:attributedTitleForRow:forComponent:)**: Called by the picker view when it needs the styled title to use for a given row in a given component.
- **pickerView(_:viewForRow:forComponent:reusing:)**: Called by the picker view when it needs the view to use for a given row in a given component.
